FuncDef:
The nat alarm ip disable command disables the log and trap functions for a global address pool.
The undo nat alarm ip disable command enables the log and alarm functions for a global address pool.
By default, the log and trap functions of a global address pool are enabled.
CLIs: nat alarm ip { log | trap } disable
undo nat alarm ip { log | trap } disable

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables the log alarm function for a global address pool.
-

Enables or disables the trap function of a global address pool.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To monitor the usage of a global address pool, run the undo nat alarm ip disable command to enable the log and trap functions of the global address pool so that the system can generate the corresponding alarms and logs.
Prerequisites
To disable the log and trap functions for a global address pool, run the nat alarm ip disable command. The command output helps monitor the usage of a global address pool.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
